title: Setting Up
text: Set up three equatinos in variable form to represent the situation $$(b=birds$$, $$m=mammals$$, and $$f=fishes)$$. We have $$b+f+m=398(0.05)$$, $$b=\operatorname{0.07}\left(398\right)+f$$, and $$f=\operatorname{0.015}\left(398\right)+m$$
speech: Set up three equatinos in variable form to represent the situation  times parentheses b is equal to, birds ,  m, is equal to, mammals , and  f, is equal to fishes  . title: Simplifying to $$1$$ Variable
text: Plug in $$m=f-0.015(398)$$ and $$b=\operatorname{0.07}\left(398\right)+f$$ into the equation containing all three variables so that only variable f is present.
speech: Plug in  m is equal to f minus, 0.015 times 398,  and  b is equal to, 0.07 of 398, plus f  into the equation containing all three variables so that only variable f is present.

title: Solving for f
text: Combine the f variables and solve for f using algebra

title: Solving for $$m$$
text: Plug in the value of f into $$m=f-0.015(398)$$ and solve for $$m$$
